message: Sphinx's API docs are also a bit of a kludge, so autogenerating epydoc (bleh) might be a big win as well
i wonder about some sort of "coverage" for documentation
It seems that the "What is this project about, and where are the important parts" a hard thing to get right, currently
Thinking out loud here. But what can RTD do to help people write better documentation, and help people use the software hosted on the site better?
i'm not sure it's really suitable to try though, because a lot of docs don't specifically mention classes and functions in a way that sphinx can recognize
not full-on auto-generation, but if it could figure out which classes and functions are documented and which aren't, it could be awesome

I try to provide real prose docs and use autodoc to provide an API reference; this has proven slightly annoying for a project using remoteobjects where I want to show the existence of a field even if it has no documentation but don't want to see repeated copies of the field's documentation - I've been meaning to look into a middle ground between undoc-members and nothing
